page.title: 02Lower Ingon Farm S.on A.
page.content: Lower Ingon is used for Beef Farming. The Farm is in Ingon Lane just off the Warwick Road.Hereford cows and bulls are kept for showing and breeding.They are known as The Ingon Herd.There are 88 acres of rough grazing and 70 head of cattle including 30 breeding cows.The cattle have a diet of hay, barley straw,and a mixture of sugar beet,bran,oats,maize and cattle nuts.They have 3 good meals a day.Only 3 people work on the farm.They start at 8am and finish when the work is done!They use a tractor,muck spreader,fertilizer spreader,hay cutter,turner,and a trailer to help them.The cattle are sold to farms all over the world including Australia,New Zealand,Oman,Ireland,and Denmark. Individual animals from the herd win almost countless prizes and trophies each year.
